notes: Level: 3 (Sezrekan) -- Range: Self -- Duration: Variable -- Casting time: 1 day -- Save: See below
general: The caster places his soul into a gem or amulet (worth at least 1d8 × 100 gp), creating a phylactery while maintaining control of his mortal body. If the body is slain, the caster's awareness shifts to the phylactery, and he must inhabit a new body within the time determined by the spell result. A new body must touch the phylactery, and a Will save is required to resist possession. The caster has no awareness of the phylactery’s surroundings while in a body.

table.1: The caster's body takes on a pallid air, and his eyes glaze over as his soul enters the phylactery.
table.2: A crack resounds in the heavens, and the air smells of copper and burnt offerings.
table.3: The caster crumples to his knees, howling in spiritual agony as his soul is torn from his mortal shell.

table.12-15: Failure, but spell is not lost.
table.16-17: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body cannot travel more than 10 miles from it; exceeding this distance causes his body to die. The caster has 1d6 + CL hours to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
table.18-21: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body cannot travel more than 50 miles from it; exceeding this distance causes his body to die. The caster has 1d10 + CL days to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
table.22-23: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body cannot travel more than 100 miles from it; exceeding this distance causes his body to die. The caster has 1d16 + CL days to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
table.24-26: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body cannot travel more than 500 miles from it; exceeding this distance causes his body to die. The caster has 1d20 + CL days to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
table.27-31: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body cannot travel more than 1,000 miles from it; exceeding this distance causes his body to die. The caster has 1d6 + CL weeks to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
table.32-33: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body can travel anywhere on this plane. Extraplanar travel causes his body to die. The caster has 1d10 + CL weeks to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
table.34-35: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body can travel anywhere in the multiverse without restrictions. If slain, the caster has 1d16 + CL weeks to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
table.36+: The caster places his soul within the phylactery. His body can travel anywhere in the multiverse without danger. If slain, the caster has 1d100 + CL years to inhabit a new body before his soul dissipates.
